Text

ONE [BROOKLYN]325-brooklyn , [NEW YORK]2-new york APRIL 2016 The first time [Lauren Williams]114-lauren ever drank a shot of whiskey in front of [[her]114-lauren boss]324-her boss was the night [the Brooklyn Bruisers]90-the bruisers clinched a play - offs berth for the first time since [Nate Kattenberger]91-nate bought [the team]325-brooklyn . It was ten o’clock , and the game against [Pittsburgh]3-pittsburgh had just rolled into its first overtime period . [The dozen or so people in [[Nate]91-nate ’s private box]327-nate ’s private box]326-the dozen or so people in nate ’s private box were tense , leaning forward in [their]326-the dozen or so people in nate ’s private box plush seats , waiting to learn what fate had in store for [the franchise]328-the franchise . [The pundits]329-the pundits had said it could n’t be done — that [a young team with [a new coach]331-a new coach]330-a young team with a new coach could n’t coalesce to advance into the postseason . Freaking pundits . A lifetime of hockey upsets had taught [Lauren]114-lauren not to trust [them]329-the pundits . Still , when team [captain Patrick O’Doul]92-o’doul buried a slap shot in the corner of the net , securing [their]329-the pundits victory , [her]114-lauren breath caught in [her]114-lauren throat . No , gasped [her]114-lauren poor , bruised heart . “ YES ! ”[332-the fans] shrieked [the fans]332-the fans . That ’s when [Lauren]114-lauren walked straight over to the bar at the side of [the team owner]333-the team owner ’s private box and poured [herself]114-lauren two fingers of Scotch , neat . Lifting it , [Lauren]114-lauren drained [her]114-lauren shot . Not that [anyone]334-anyone noticed [her]114-lauren sudden affinity for whiskey . [The rest of [the VIPs]336-the vips in [the room]337-the room]335-the rest of the vips in the room rushed over to congratulate [[her]114-lauren boss]324-her boss . It was a big moment for [the young billionaire who owned [the team]325-brooklyn]339-the young billionaire who owned the team . A great moment . And somewhere deep inside in [her]114-lauren creaky soul [Lauren]114-lauren was happy for [him]339-the young billionaire who owned the team . But this was a disaster for [her]114-lauren . [Lauren]114-lauren forced [herself]114-lauren to walk over and look down at [the rink]341-the rink where [the players]342-the players were celebrating [their]342-the players victory . [They]342-the players ’d convened into a knot of purple jerseys , rubbing helmets and slapping asses in the way of [victorious athletes]343-victorious athletes everywhere . There had been a time when [this team]325-brooklyn had been [Lauren]114-lauren ’s whole life . Until the sudden , awful moment when it was n’t anymore . Somewhere in that clot of [players down below]344-players down below was [the one who ’d turned [her]114-lauren entire world upside down]345-the one who ’d turned her entire world upside down . Not only had [he]345-the one who ’d turned her entire world upside down broken [her]114-lauren heart , but [he]345-the one who ’d turned her entire world upside down ’d made it impossible for [her]114-lauren to feel comfortable in the organization to which [she]114-lauren ’d devoted more than a decade of [her]114-lauren life . For the past two years , [she]114-lauren ’d avoided [this team]325-brooklyn , [this rink]341-the rink , and everything to do with hockey . [She]114-lauren ’d avoided [the entire borough of [Brooklyn]325-brooklyn]346-the entire borough of brooklyn , except when [[her]114-lauren boss]324-her boss ’s business brought the two of [them]344-players down below over [the bridge]348-the bridge for a meeting . And the moment [she]114-lauren was free to go , [Lauren]114-lauren always hightailed it back to [Manhattan]4-manhattan where [she]114-lauren belonged . But not this month . A week ago , [Nate]91-nate had asked [her]114-lauren to manage [[the hockey team]325-brooklyn ’s office]349-the hockey team ’s office for the balance of the season . [The young woman who usually did that job]350-the young woman who usually did that job had suffered a concussion , and [he]350-the young woman who usually did that job needed [someone capable to step in]351-someone capable to step in . Since [Lauren]114-lauren used to do precisely that job for [the team]325-brooklyn before [the franchise]325-brooklyn moved to [Brooklyn]325-brooklyn , [she]114-lauren was the obvious choice . Unfortunately . And if [the Bruisers]90-the bruisers had n’t made it to the play - offs , [she]114-lauren would have been finished with [them]344-players down below by next week . However . The Scotch in [Lauren]114-lauren ’s belly fired [her]114-lauren courage , and [she]114-lauren glanced down at the ice again . The play - offs were composed of four seven - game series , each taking more than two weeks . The Stanley Cup would n’t be decided for two months . There was no telling how far [the team]325-brooklyn would go . So [Lauren]114-lauren would have to spend at least a couple more weeks traveling with [the very people [she]350-the young woman who usually did that job ’d worked so hard to avoid]352-the very people she ’d worked so hard to avoid . And there was no way out of it , unless [she]114-lauren wanted to quit [her]114-lauren job . And that was n’t happening . The next sound [she]114-lauren heard was the pop of a cork . “ Did it ! ”[357-becca] cried [Rebecca Rowley]357-becca , [the woman who was supposed to be running [[the Bruisers]90-the bruisers ’ [Brooklyn]325-brooklyn office]353-the bruisers ’ brooklyn office]357-becca . [She]114-lauren held a magnum of [Cristal]94-cristal in two hands , which [she]114-lauren now levered toward the first of a row of champagne flutes . [Lauren]114-lauren ’s eyes narrowed at this display of joy . [Miss Perky]95-miss perky was supposedly recovering from a rather serious head injury [she]95-miss perky ’d sustained by walking out onto [the ice rink in [her]95-miss perky street shoes]354-the ice rink in her street shoes . What had seemed like a minor fall had resulted in terrible symptoms for [the poor fool]355-the poor fool . [She]95-miss perky ’d been absent from work for a week already , and was therefore the cause of [Lauren]114-lauren ’s sudden craving for Scotch whiskey . But now [Becca]357-becca passed around glasses as if nothing in [the world]356-the world were wrong with [her]357-becca . [She]357-becca poured another glass as [[her]357-becca friend]357-becca [Georgia]96-georgia — [one of [the team publicists]358-the team publicists]357-becca — skated into [the room]337-the room with a grin on [her]357-becca face . “ Press conference in ten minutes [guys]1866-guys . Oh ! Champagne . ”[357-becca] “ Have some . ”[357-becca] [Becca]357-becca handed [Georgia]96-georgia a glass , then moved on to [[their]360-their boss]361-their boss , who gave [her]357-becca a hundred watt smile . “ [I]357-becca ’m so happy for [you]357-becca , ”[357-becca] [Becca]357-becca crowed , stretching [her]357-becca arms around [the billionaire]362-the billionaire and giving [him]362-the billionaire a big friendly squeeze . [Nate]91-nate looked a little stunned by the full - frontal embrace . As usual , [he]362-the billionaire did a poor job of concealing [his]362-the billionaire reaction to [Rebecca]357-becca . [His]362-the billionaire arms did what [they]363-they probably always wanted to do , and closed around [her]357-becca back . [His]362-the billionaire eyes fell shut , too . [Lauren]114-lauren had to look away . The yearning just rose off [Nate]91-nate like a mist . Hell — hugging [Rebecca]357-becca might be as exciting to [Nate]91-nate as the hockey victory itself . [Rebecca]357-becca pulled back a moment later , as oblivious to [him]91-nate as [she]357-becca always was . [She]357-becca grabbed another glass of champagne off the table and held it out to [Lauren]114-lauren . “ Champagne ? [I]357-becca know [you]357-becca are n’t really [a drinker]1867-a drinker but . . . ”[357-becca] [Lauren]114-lauren took the glass from [Miss Perky]95-miss perky and took a gulp immediately . “ Thanks . ”[114-lauren] “ [You]357-becca ’re . . . welcome , ”[357-becca] [Becca]357-becca said , [her]357-becca eyes full of surprise . Then [she]357-becca scooped up two more glasses and moved off to serve [someone else]364-someone else , [her]357-becca hips swaying to the victory music that was playing in the stadium—“No Sleep Till [Brooklyn]325-brooklyn ”[357-becca] by [the Beastie Boys]97-the beastie boys . [Lauren]114-lauren checked [[her]114-lauren boss]324-her boss ’s face , and found [his]324-her boss gaze tracking [Becca]357-becca across [the walnut - paneled room]366-the walnut - paneled room . [Lauren]114-lauren had been witness to this little romantic farce for the past two years . It was like living in a sitcom that [she]114-lauren could never shut off . And yet , if [Nate]91-nate ’s pining for [Becca]357-becca were the most irritating thing about [Lauren]114-lauren ’s situation at work , [she]114-lauren would n’t be drinking tonight . [Her]114-lauren problem was n’t with the work [she]114-lauren ’d be doing these next few weeks . Before [Nate Kattenberger]91-nate bought and rebranded [the Long Island team]340-this team , [she]114-lauren ’d spent ten years working in [the Syosset offices]368-the syosset offices . It had been [Lauren]114-lauren that managed [[the team]340-this team ’s office]369-the team ’s office during its last three play - offs runs . Heck , [Lauren]114-lauren was [the veteran]114-lauren and [Becca]357-becca was [the rookie]114-lauren . But then , two years ago , [the young Internet whiz]370-the young internet whiz made a lot of changes to [the organization]371-the organization . [Lauren]114-lauren expected to be fired along with the rest of the casualties . In fact , [[her]114-lauren father]372-dad — [the team ’s general manager]373-the team ’s general manager — was the first person [Nate]91-nate axed after the purchase went through . [Lauren]114-lauren was n’t fired , though . On the contrary , when [Nate]91-nate moved [the team]340-this team to [Brooklyn]325-brooklyn , [he]91-nate stunned [her]114-lauren by moving [her]114-lauren even further — whisking [her]114-lauren into [the corporate headquarters of [[his]91-nate Internet company in [Manhattan]4-manhattan]375-his internet company in manhattan]374-the corporate headquarters of his internet company in manhattan . [She]114-lauren ’d been ecstatic about this promotion , since working for [Nate]91-nate ’s Fortune 500 company was exactly the sort of corporate leap [she]114-lauren ’d always hoped to make . Not only that , but the move away from [the hockey team]340-this team solved a lot of problems for [Lauren]114-lauren all in one fell swoop , including the one huge problem that had suddenly knocked [her]114-lauren on [her]114-lauren ass . And that problem was down on the ice right now , draped in sweaty goalie pads , lining up to skate past [the other team]376-the other team for the traditional handshake . For the millionth time this week , [Lauren]114-lauren closed [her]114-lauren eyes and prayed to be spirited back to [[Nate]91-nate ’s office tower]377-nate ’s office tower where there were n’t [any hockey players]378-any hockey players , and there were n’t any reminders of [the man who ’d crushed [her]114-lauren spirit]379-the man who ’d crushed her spirit . But as long as [Becca]357-becca was unable to work , [Lauren]114-lauren was stuck in [Brooklyn]325-brooklyn . And now that [the Bruisers]90-the bruisers had won [their]380-their freaking play - offs slot , it meant a hailstorm of planning and administrative overtime . Four rounds , potentially . Two months . And travel . “ [Lauren]114-lauren . ”[91-nate] [Nate]91-nate ’s voice cut through [her]114-lauren reverie . “ Please call Becca [a car]1868-a car . TEN [BROOKLYN]325-brooklyn , [NEW YORK]2-new york APRIL 2016 The next morning at ten thirty , [Mike]2343-mike keyed in the security code on the door of [his]2343-mike brownstone and walked inside . [He]2343-mike tossed [his]2343-mike duffel bag onto the floor and kicked off [his]2343-mike shoes . Then [he]2343-mike listened . [Violins]177-violins — [two of [them]177-violins]177-violins . [Elsa]2199-elsa and [Hans]120-hans were practicing . The piece was something fun and fast , with one violin chasing the other one around the melody . The effect was like two chattering squirrels zipping around a tree . [He]2343-mike just stood there in [the entryway]2158-the entryway to [[his]2343-mike own home]525-the house for several minutes , listening until the piece broke down . “[925-you] [You]925-you said to repeat ! ” [Elsa]2199-elsa said with a giggle . “[925-you] But not there ! ” [Hans]120-hans argued , [his]120-hans voice amused . “[925-you] Go back to measure fifty - five . Let ’s finish this before [I]91-nate ’m old . ” The music started up again , and [he]120-hans walked slowly through [the house]525-the house . [He]120-hans ’d overpaid for [this place]525-the house , but it was gorgeous . The Wall Street couple who ’d sold it to [him]120-hans had done a modern renovation down to the studs . [They]2160-they ’d opened up [the rooms]2161-the rooms to make a clean and bright space , with lots of natural light . It was ridiculously contemporary , though , with every surface painted either a shimmering white or an expensive shade of dove gray . The light fixtures resembled space age bird ’s nests . Or something . [He]120-hans could n’t quite decide what the hell [they]2160-they were supposed to be . [He]120-hans ’d paid [a decorator]2162-a decorator to choose from all the furniture [they]2160-they owned and refinish and reupholster some of it to suit the space . [She]2199-elsa ’d done a good job warming the space up with honey - colored wood finishes and touches of color . [He]120-hans ’d probably been [a dream client]2163-a dream client — checkbook open and no patience to sweat the details . [Mike]2343-mike was still smiling as [he]2343-mike climbed [the stairs]2018-the stairs toward [[Elsa]2199-elsa ’s room]2165-elsa ’s room . The violins got louder . There was no greater moment in parenting than listening to [[your]2166-your kid]673-your kid play [Mozart]178-mozart or who - the - fuck - ever and laughing . [They]2160-they ’d had some really dark days these past couple of years . But a few things went right , the biggest one being [Hans]120-hans . It had originally been [Shelly]2023-shelly ’s idea to ask [the violin teacher]2168-the violin teacher to move in with [them]2160-they . [Hans]120-hans was in [his]120-hans twenties — [[your]2166-your basic starving artist]120-hans . During the week [he]120-hans auditioned for orchestra gigs . On the weekends [he]120-hans ’d charged [Long Island parents]2169-long island parents fifty - five bucks for a half hour of [his]120-hans time . [Elsa]2199-elsa had taken to [him]120-hans immediately , and [he]120-hans ’d been [[her]2199-elsa teacher]2168-the violin teacher for years . NINETEEN [TAMPA]38-tampa , [FLORIDA]37-florida MAY 2016 Four days later [Lauren]114-lauren knelt in child ’s pose on [her]114-lauren yoga mat , which [she]114-lauren ’d unfurled on the wood floor in [an exercise studio]2572-an exercise studio in [the team ’s Tampa hotel]337-the room . At the front of [the room]337-the room , [Ari]150-ari took [the class]2574-the class through some breathing exercises . [Lauren]114-lauren expanded [her]114-lauren diaphragm on command , inhaling deeply . But [she]114-lauren tuned [Ari]150-ari out in favor of indulging [herself]114-lauren in a few private play - offs calculations . The location of play - offs series games was always dependent on team standings . In this case , [Tampa]38-tampa had entered the postseason with the higher ranking . So [they]2575-they ’d enjoyed a home ice advantage for the first two games . Then there had been two in [Brooklyn]325-brooklyn — the one where [Mike]2343-mike fought [Skews]422-skews , and then another . Which [they]2575-they ’d lost , unfortunately . The series was now tied 2–2 , and [Lauren]114-lauren was hoping [[her]114-lauren boys]2495-her boys could win the next two in a row . According to the rules , game five was back in [Tampa]38-tampa , which accounted for the location of [today ’s team yoga class]2577-today ’s team yoga class . Game six would happen in [Brooklyn]325-brooklyn . If [the Bruisers]699-the bruisers could win two in a row , the series would be over then . However . If the series lasted seven games , the final one would take place in [Tampa]38-tampa . That was n’t going to be good for [Lauren]114-lauren . TWENTY - ONE When [Lauren]114-lauren reentered [the hotel lobby]2155-the hotel lobby after the game , [she]114-lauren found that it had become ground zero for [the Bruisers]90-the bruisers ’ victory party . [She]114-lauren was surveying the scene when [Jimbo]1931-jimbo trotted up and squeezed [her]114-lauren elbow . “[91-nate] [I]91-nate asked [the hotel]2110-the hotel if [you]1311-you ’d made any arrangements for food and soft drinks , ” [he]1931-jimbo said . “[91-nate] [They]1312-they did n’t have anything on order . ” “[1312-they] Right . ” [Lauren]114-lauren whipped out [her]114-lauren Katt Phone and pulled up [the catering manager]2642-the catering manager ’s line . “[1312-they] [Some of [the guys]1881-the guys]1313-some of the guys think it ’s bad luck to plan a victory party beforehand , ” [she]114-lauren explained . “[1312-they] [They]1313-some of the guys ’d rather wait an extra half hour for [their]1313-some of the guys chicken wings than have [me]91-nate jinx [them]1313-some of the guys . ” “[1312-they] Good , ” [Jimbo]1931-jimbo grinned . “[1312-they] Because [I]91-nate just ordered ten dozen wings and a few plates of nachos . Hope [you]1311-you do n’t mind . ” “[1311-you] That ’s fine . Drinks ? ” “[91-nate] [I]91-nate thought [I]91-nate ’d let [you]1311-you handle that . Sure enough , [Castro]229-castro and [Beringer]164-beringer arrived a moment later to cheers . [Lauren]114-lauren flitted about , checking on the status of [the transport vehicles]2649-the transport vehicles and taking care of business . [Everyone]436-everyone was smiling and jubilant , yet [she]114-lauren fought off an unhappy void right in the middle of [her]114-lauren chest . This morning [Lauren]114-lauren had taken an ovulation test . It was [your]114-lauren basic pee - on - a - stick situation , and performed in the privacy of [[her]114-lauren hotel room]2579-her hotel room . A minute after executing this maneuver , the digital readout showed [her]114-lauren a smiley face . [She]114-lauren ’d been wearing a frowny face ever since .
